TopicTitle: Duranis Plays KSP Modded Career Mode - Episode 6 finally EXPLOSIONS!!

Articles.Content:
So for a long time I have been thinking about starting my own YouTube gaming channel and now I have finally actually done it. At the moment I plan to have "Let's plays" on The hunter, Kerbal Space Program, Banished and Minecraft.

Duranis Plays Modded Kerbal Space Program.

Episode 1 - Humble Beginnings.

http://youtu.be/4u58H-r2ho4

In this first episode I try and cover all the basics of playing so handy if you are new to KSP and have no idea what is going on.

Episode 2 - Fly me to the Mun!

Episode 3 - ScanSat and Infernal Robotics - Scanning the Moons!

Episode 4 - Interplanetary Space and booster rocket fun.

Episode 5 - Heading to Duna and Scientific Explosions!

Episode 6 - Finally Explosions! Conclusion of our Interstellar Mod impactor experiment on Duna.

Link to Channel for more videos:

https://www.youtube.com/user/MrDuranis/videos

I also have the Twitters

https://twitter.com/DuranisLP

Any and all comments and feedback greatly appreciated.

Edited April 24, 2014 by Duranis

Thank you.

First episode is a little basic for people that have played KSP quite a bit but I also wanted it to serve as a bit of an introduction for the people that haven't played it before or are just getting started.

Future episodes cut out a lot more of the "newbie"/slow stuff

Episode 2 is now live

Episode 3 to 5 is already recorded
Episode 3 is now live. In this episode we play a little with infernal robotics and map the Mun and Minmus using ScanSat.

Episode 4 of KSP is now live where I shoot a test kerbal into interplanetary space to see if he explodes and mess about a bit with big solid rocket boosters.

http://youtu.be/bWYE_Udv2vo

Episode 5 of KSP is now live. In this Episode we head to Duna and use the KSP Interstellar version of the Seismic Accelerometer (and a few explosions) to get a ton of science!

http://youtu.be/gks34Ozgspk
Episode 6 is now live. In this episode things finally explode and we get a ton of science from it (but more importantly, things explode!)
